always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan with the `submit_day_plan` function for each day of the trip!

name: root
engine_repr:

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"

msg.content: Could you help me design a one-week travel itinerary departing from Devils Lake and heading to Colorado, covering a total of 3 cities? The travel dates are set between March 22nd and March 28th, 2022. This trip is for a single person with a budget of $3,500.

Could you help me design a one-week travel itinerary departing from Devils Lake and heading to Colorado, covering a total of 3 cities? The travel dates are set between March 22nd and March 28th, 2022. This trip is for a single person with a budget of $3,500.

Sure! I've designed a one-week itinerary from Devils Lake to Colorado with a budget of $3,500, covering 3 cities:

## Day 1: Devils Lake to Alamosa, CO
- Travel from Devils Lake to Alamosa by car (29 hours, 20 minutes). Please note that this is a long drive, so ensure you plan for rest stops and overnight stays if needed.
- Upon arrival in Alamosa, check into your accommodation. I suggest staying at the Hampton Inn Alamosa, a comfortable hotel with an indoor pool and a free shuttle service.
- In the evening, explore the historic San Luis Valley Brewing Company for a taste of local beers.

## Day 2: Exploring Alamosa
- Start your day at the Rio Grande Scenic Railroad, a unique way to experience the stunning scenery. This train ride offers breathtaking views of the mountains and wildlife.
- After the train ride, visit the Alamosa National Wildlife Refuge, home to various bird species and wildlife. Go on a guided tour or enjoy a peaceful hike.
- For lunch, try May Cafe, known for its delicious Mexican cuisine and friendly atmosphere.
- In the afternoon, explore the San Luis Valley History Museum to learn about the region's rich history.
- End your day at the San Luis Valley Brewing Company again for dinner and live music.

## Day 3: Alamosa to Colorado Springs
- Depart Alamosa and drive to Colorado Springs (3 hours, 40 minutes).
- Check into The Mining Exchange, a boutique hotel in the heart of the city.
- Start your exploration at Garden of the Gods Park, a natural landmark with towering red rock formations and hiking trails.
- Visit the iconic Pikes Peak, a mountain offering scenic views and a unique cog railway experience.
- For dinner, try the award-winning Colorado Springs restaurant, The Penrose Room, for fine dining and a memorable culinary experience.

## Day 4: Exploring Colorado Springs
- Visit the Cheyenne Mountain Zoo, one of the most scenic zoos in the country. It's located in the mountains and offers up-close encounters with various animal species.
- After the zoo, explore the Manitou Cliff Dwellings, ancient cliffside homes, for a glimpse into the region's history.
- In the afternoon, visit the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Museum to learn about sports history.
- Enjoy a relaxing dinner at Rasta Pasta, a popular restaurant known for its Caribbean-Italian fusion cuisine.

## Day 5: Colorado Springs to Gunnison
- Drive from Colorado Springs to Gunnison (4 hours).
- Check into the Water Wheel Inn, a cozy lodge with beautiful mountain views.
- Take a guided tour of the Gunnison Pioneer Museum to learn about the town's pioneers.
- Enjoy a casual dinner at The Gunnisack, a local favourite serving classic American dishes.

## Day 6: Exploring Gunnison
- Spend the day at Blue Mesa Reservoir, a beautiful lake offering various outdoor activities. Go boating, fishing, or hiking along the trails nearby.
- For lunch, head to The Firebrand Delicatessen for a quick bite and delicious sandwiches.
- In the afternoon, visit the Curecanti National Recreation Area for more outdoor adventures and scenic views.
- End the day with a visit to The W Cafe for a unique dining experience; this cafe is located in a historic building and serves eclectic cuisine.

## Day 7: Return to Devils Lake
- Begin the journey back to Devils Lake by car. This will be a long drive, so consider breaking it up with stops or an overnight stay if needed.

I've submitted the daily plans for the trip. Please note that this itinerary focuses on a mix of outdoor adventures, cultural experiences, and culinary delights. Adjustments can be made based on personal preferences. Enjoy your trip to Colorado!

I've submitted the daily plans for the trip. Please note that this itinerary focuses on a mix of outdoor adventures, cultural experiences, and culinary delights. Adjustments can be made based on personal preferences. Enjoy your trip to Colorado!
